Community & CRM Manager
description:
About Jobgether

Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

we are currently looking for a Community & CRM Manager to join our team ‚Äî this is a part-time remote role open to candidates worldwide.

As a Community & CRM Manager, you‚Äôll play a key role in creating meaningful engagement with remote job seekers and building an active, empowered global community. You‚Äôll take full ownership of the candidate communication experience ‚Äî from onboarding emails to job alerts and feedback ‚Äî ensuring every interaction is thoughtful, useful, and personalized. You'll also act as the voice of the user, gathering insights and championing ideas that help improve the overall candidate journey. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, loves connecting with people, and enjoys transforming feedback into action.

Accountabilities:

  • You‚Äôll own and grow the candidate community, making it a space where remote job seekers feel supported, heard, and empowered.
  • Take full ownership of our candidate email experience ‚Äî from welcome flows to job alerts and application feedback.
  • Be the bridge between our users and our product, ensuring we're building something they truly love.
  • Build and manage an active online community across Slack, Discord, LinkedIn, and other platforms.
  • Launch and lead an Ambassador Program to engage passionate users as advocates.
  • Organize virtual community events like webinars, AMAs, and meetups.
  • Own and optimize all email communications: onboarding, re-engagement, updates, and newsletters.
  • Create smart, personalized email journeys using CRM tools (HubSpot, Customer.io, etc.).
  • Collaborate with product and content teams to align messaging and amplify impact.
  • Continuously test and iterate on email flows to improve performance.
  • Collect, analyze, and share community insights with internal teams to drive growth and improvements.

¬†

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in community management, CRM/email marketing, or a related role.
  • Strong communication and writing skills in English.
  • Solid experience with CRM and email automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Instantly, Customer.io).
  • Comfortable analyzing metrics and optimizing based on data.
  • Naturally proactive, organized, and able to manage multiple projects at once.
  • Passionate about remote work, community engagement, and user-centric growth.
  • Bonus: background in remote work platforms, job boards, or HR tech.

Benefits

  • üåç 100% remote ‚Äî work from anywhere in the world
  • üöÄ Join a mission-driven startup shaping the future of work
  • üåê Be part of a diverse and international team with big ambitions
  • üì£ Your voice matters ‚Äî influence how we grow and what we build
  • üéì Learning and growth opportunities within a fast-scaling environment
  • ü§ù A culture that values initiative, collaboration, and impact

¬†

title: VIP Account Manager Team Lead
description:
Growe welcomes those who are excited to:

  • Lead the VIP team, supervise and mentor Account Managers, ensuring they meet performance goals;

  • Develop and execute VIP strategies to enhance VIP customer experience and engagement;

  • Monitor and analyze VIP data, identifying trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement;

  • Build strong relationships and address VIP needs promptly;

  • Collaborate with other departments, ensuring a seamless VIP experience;

  • Develop and execute VIP strategies to increase VIP acquisition;

  • Assist the Head of VIP, including planning outbound campaigns, reporting on ROI, and guiding KPIs;

  • Track team effectiveness, communicate essential information, and provide feedback on trends;

  • Ensure client contact to maintain regular contact with VIPs, ensuring the quality of work and performance;

  • Set performance goals, conduct monthly reviews, QAs, and participate in hiring processes;

  • Motivate the team, provide constructive feedback, and contribute positively to team dynamics.

We need your professional experience:

  • 3+ years in VIP management or a similar role;

  • Experience in EU Markets;

  • Team management experience;

  • Strong analytical skills;

  • Experience in Account Management, Customer Relationship roles, preferably in the iGaming industry;

  • Understanding of the iGaming and Sports betting market and related KPIs.

We appreciate if you have those personal features:

  • Highly organized with excellent attention to detail;

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;

  • Problem-solving skills.

We are seeking those who align with our core values:

  • GROWE TOGETHER: Our team is our main asset. We work together and support each other to achieve our common goals;

  • DRIVE RESULT OVER PROCESS: We set ambitious, clear, measurable goals in line with our strategy and driving Growe to success;

  • BE READY FOR CHANGE: We see challenges as opportunities to grow and evolve. We adapt today to win tomorrow.

title: Reporting and Metrics Analyst
description:
Company Background

With 30 years of experience in cyber defense, DeepSeas is trusted by nearly 1,000 clients around the world, including Fortune 100 enterprises and mid-market organizations, higher education institutions, municipality and local governments, and federal agencies. Known for its programmatic approach to continuously transforming cyber defense programs, DeepSeas is recognized by Gartner as a top 40 provider of MDR and ranked as a top 5 MDR leader in the 2024 Frost Radar‚Ñ¢: Global Managed Detection and Response (MDR) Market. In addition to its industry-leading MDR service, DeepSeas offers a full suite of advisory, compliance, and testing services to support clients on their cybersecurity transformation journeys, with an approach to cyber defense that prioritizes technical expertise, tradecraft, and continuous innovation to deliver unparalleled results.

¬†
Position Overview
The Cybersecurity Data & Analytics Consultant leverages technical skills to enable data-driven decision-making in enterprise security operations. This role combines cybersecurity domain knowledge with advanced analytics, data engineering, and visualization to deliver actionable insights that support executive reporting, incident response, and program governance. Ideal for a technically inclined professional eager to apply data science and automation in a strategic consulting context.



Key Responsibilities
Data Analysis & Engineering:
  • Collect, clean, and transform complex cybersecurity datasets (e.g., incident data, SLA metrics, ticketing systems) for analysis and reporting.
  • Automate data collection pipelines using tools such as Python, Power Query, or APIs where feasible.
  • Develop and maintain structured data repositories, documentation, and source mappings.
¬†Visualization & Reporting:
  • ¬†Build interactive dashboards and reporting artifacts using Power BI, Tableau, or Python visualization libraries (e.g., Plotly, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
  • Translate data trends into strategic narratives for executive and stakeholder consumption.
  • Align reporting deliverables to cybersecurity KPIs and client-specific objectives.
Advanced Analytics:
  • ¬†Apply statistical analysis, predictive modeling, or machine learning techniques to support risk forecasting, anomaly detection, or incident pattern recognition.
  • Explore opportunities to enhance automation and intelligence in SOC reporting and governance programs.
Security Program Support:
  • Work with security leaders to understand operational challenges and turn raw data into business-relevant insights.
  • Contribute to the improvement of governance artifacts, such as process documentation, workflows, and runbooks, through the lens of technical analysis.
Client-Facing Consulting:
  • Participate in stakeholder meetings and clearly communicate findings, methodologies, and recommendations.
  • Adapt to different client environments and tailor solutions based on maturity, tooling, and strategic goals.


Skills, Knowledge and Expertise
  • ¬†Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or open-source alternatives)
  • ¬†Familiarity with databases (SQL), APIs, and data integration techniques
  • Working knowledge of cybersecurity principles, frameworks (NIST, MITRE), and security operations workflows
  • Ability to explain complex technical insights to non-technical stakeholders
  • Self-starter with a passion for learning and applying advanced analytics in cybersecurity
  • ¬†Experience with statistical methods, forecasting, or machine learning is a strong plus


Benefits
Why DeepSeas?
At DeepSeas, we like to say that heart rates go down, careers take off, and security programs mature. Our values provide the ultimate guide for our daily behavior and decisions. Without these values, we aren‚Äôt DeepSeas. They preserve the essence of our organization, reflect the personalities of our Deeps (how we affectionately refer to our teammates), and enable us to exceed expectations. Our values are:
  • We are client obsessed.¬†
  • We stand in solidarity with our teammates.
  • We prioritize personal health and well-being.
  • ¬†We believe in the power of diversity.
  • We solve hard problems at the speed of cyber.
This is your chance to join a supportive crew of teammates and an industry-leading organization that values opportunities for growth. If DeepSeas sounds like a good fit for you, send us your resume and let‚Äôs talk!

Information security is everyone‚Äôs responsibility:
  • Understanding and following DeepSeas‚Äôs information security policies and procedures.
  • Remaining vigilant and reporting any suspicious activity or possible weaknesses in DeepSeas‚Äôs information security.
  • Actively participating in DeepSeas‚Äôs efforts to maintain and improve information security.
  • DeepSeas considers this position is as Moderate Risk with a potential to view/access/download restricted/private client/internal data. This information must be treated with sensitivity and in the most secure manner.¬†
  • HR reserves the right to perform random background/drug screens to ensure the safety of client/DeepSeas data
